title: Should I take drop instead of taking mechanical at pes?

comments.body: Take drop or join cs in a not so popular institute but work hard in developing skills( i prefer option2)
Idk man but won’t it be worth it if I get into bits next year?
Hey, just wondering, can you shift branches after 1st year?

Yes you can but from what I’ve heard it’s really hard, you can only change if vacancies are available in the 2nd year that itself is a big if and even if there are vacancies you need at least 9.5+ cgpa basically in the top of your branch across both campuses to be eligible to change to a better branch

Hii there.

Mechanical engineer from PES here.

Please take mechanical only if you're really really interested in it. Especially so if yours is a PESSAT seat.

Mechanical subjects from 4th semester onwards are really hard and require a lot of effort to clear in the first go.

And even if you do well, there's no guarantee you'll get a job with a decent salary.

If you are really interested in Mechanical, then I'd suggest you go to a different college (RV BMS Dayanand Sagar etc ) then do a master's course abroad (Germany Netherlands etc). You'll have a much better career then. 

And do not take mechanical expecting that you can change branches in the second year. The competation is really high.
Yes, you can, but it requires gaining a very high CGPA almost 9+. It also depends on the branch you are in, and changing to
Yes it will be worth it. If you believe in yourself take a drop.
Only one person shifted to RR CS from RR ECE in batch 25. Don't count on mech to cs
